section.heading: Secure Storage Required.
section.text: When not being used for an election, all voting units, voting equipment, and other voting materials shall be maintained in a secure storage facility.

para.text: Under the direct and sole control of the local board;
Secure from access by unauthorized persons;
In reasonably close proximity to the local board office;
To meet the manufacturer's environmental standards for storage of the equipment;
To meet environmental standards necessary for storage of paper ballots without degradation; and
So that authorized persons can comfortably conduct required pre-election and post-election testing and maintenance of voting equipment; and
Supplied with telecommunication services whenever a local board member, staff member, or contractor is at the facility.
State Board May Grant. On application by a local board, the State Board may grant a temporary waiver from one or more of the requirements of this chapter for good cause.
Expiration. A temporary waiver granted under this chapter expires on the earlier of the:
First anniversary of its issuance; or
Date specified by the State Board.
Extension. If circumstances require an extension of the temporary waiver, the application for an extension shall:
Specify all actions taken by the local board to correct the deficiency in question; and
Explain why those actions were unavailing.
